identificationModule.briefTitle: Taiwan Associated Genetic and Nongenetic Small Vessel Disease
identificationModule.officialTitle: Deciphering, Construction and Validation of Magnetic Resonance Imaging Maps, Clinical Features and Outcomes in Genetic and Nongenetic Cerebral Small Vessel Diseases

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The TAG-SVD enrolled patients with clinical and neuroimaging features of cerebral small vessel disease (CSVD). All enrolled patients will receive next-generation sequence (NGS) with probes designed to target five candidate CSVD genes, and patients will be divided into genetic or non-genetic groups accordingly. Their clinical features and outcome will be followed for at least 2 years.

conditions: COL4A1-Related Brain Small Vessel Disease With Haemorrhage

bioSpec.description: Each patient had a blood sample collected, and their DNA was extracted and sent for next-generation sequencing (NGS) with probes designed to target five candidate CSVD genes.

armGroups.label: Genetic group
armGroups.description: Patients who have positive DNA results by NGS screening of the following 5 genes: NOTCH3 (19q13.12), HTRA1 (10q26.13), GLA (Xq22.1), TREX1 (3p1.31) and COL4A1 (13q34).

armGroups.label: Nongenetic group
armGroups.description: Patients who have negative DNA results by NGS screening .

interventions.name: MRI
interventions.description: Patients will repeat study-protocol MRI at baseline (enrollment) and at least once in 1 year or 2 years follow-up (depends on availability).

primaryOutcomes.measure: Number of patients with incident stroke
primaryOutcomes.description:
Clinical stroke, including transient ischemic attack, ischemic stroke, or intracerebral hemorrhage.

The stroke is defined by a focal neurological deficits lasting more than 24 hours, with accompanied neuroimaging evidence of infarct or hemorrhage in corresponding brain area.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of patients with incident dementia
secondaryOutcomes.description:
Vascular cognitive impairment (VCI), vascular dementia (VaD), or Alzheimer's dementia or Vascular dementia according to latest diagnostic criteria.

Alzheimer's disease diagnostic criteria: National Institute of Aging-Alzheimer's Association workgroups on diagnostic guidelines for Alzheimer's disease (PMID: 21514247)

Vascular dementia diagnostic criteria: Diagnosis and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, Fifth Edition

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

Participants must have at least one of the following symptoms/signs or history

* stroke (especially small vessel occlusion type of ischaemic stroke, spontaneous ICH or young stroke)
* cognitive impairment or dementia
* gait disturbance
* parkinsonism (especially vascular parkinsonism features)
* headache (especially migraine)
* positive family history of hereditary CSVD
* MRI evidence of CSVD (MRI may be done for other reasons), including mild to moderate white matter hyper intensity, any lacune, or any cerebral microbleed

Exclusion Criteria:

* MRI evidence of CSVD due to other inflammatory, malignancy, or structural lesions
* patients or family members not willing to sign informed consent
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: This study enrolled patients with clini-cal and neuroimaging features of CSVD in the neurology outpatient clinic of National Taiwan University Hospital. The clinical features for being enrolled in the TAG-SVD cohort included stroke (especially small vessel occlusion type of ischaemic stroke, spontaneous ICH or young stroke), cognitive impairment, gait disturbance, parkinsonism, headache or a positive family history of hereditary CSVD. The neuroimaging features were at least one evident magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) feature of CSVD

locations.facility: Department of Neurology, National Taiwan University Hospital

references.citation: Chen CH, Chu YT, Chen YF, Ko TY, Cheng YW, Lee MJ, Chen PL, Tang SC, Jeng JS. Comparison of clinical and neuroimaging features between NOTCH3 mutations and nongenetic spontaneous intracerebral haemorrhage. Eur J Neurol. 2022 Nov;29(11):3243-3254. doi: 10.1111/ene.15485. Epub 2022 Jul 18.

ipdSharingStatementModule.description: Data that support the current study are available upon reasonable request to the corresponding author.

ancestors.term: Malformations of Cortical Development, Group III
